title: [Self-Directed] Self-Directed Learning Design to Improve Learning Feasibility in Programming Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental programming syntax and mathematical problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Advanced programming system learning environment for mathematical domain applications. Aims to enhance workplace efficiency for professionals

learning_goals: Learners can independently write code to solve mathematical problems by utilizing the five core functionalities of programming systems: annotatable, scriptable, monitorable, supplementable, and constrainable
Learners improve learning efficiency by utilizing self-directed learning tools within the LMS (automated feedback systems, step-by-step guides, community forums) at a frequency of over 80%
Learners understand the learnability design principles of programming systems and can create three or more new mathematical problem-solving strategies based on this understanding

resources: Integrated Programming System Learning Tools (IDE Plugins)
Sample Dataset for Mathematical Problem Solving

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
